hook.text: A 60-minute meeting had no agenda, no facilitator, and 14 attendees. Nothing was decided.

buildup.text: Meetings without structure are group conversations. Group conversations rarely produce decisions.

discovery.text: Basic hygiene: agenda in advance, clear facilitator, defined outcome, minimum attendees.

twist.text: Cutting meeting time from 60 to 30 minutes often produces the same or better outcomes.

climax.text: End every meeting with: who does what by when? If there's no answer, the meeting failed.

punchline.text: No agenda, no attend. That should be a company rule.

quiz.question: What is the most important element of meeting hygiene?
options: A clear agenda with defined outcomes shared in advance
Having as many attendees as possible for broader input
Scheduling meetings for at least 60 minutes to be thorough
